arm_group.description: ESRD patients awaiting renal transplantation who are expected to get a renal transplant in the next few months

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to understand cognitive impairment in end stage renal disease
      before and after a kidney transplant.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cognitive Impairment and Imaging Correlates in End Stage Renal Disease

detailed_description.textblock:
Cognitive impairment is very common in patients with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD). It
      exact mechanisms are not clear, but patients with ESRD have more cerebral white matter
      changes seen in brain imaging. Several studies have shown that cognitive function improves
      post-transplant, indicating that there may be some reversibility in the process. This study
      will examine the correlation between cognitive impairment and structural brain changes
      before and after renal transplantation. We will also study the correlation of cognitive
      function with serum inflammatory markers before and after transplant.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Pre-transplant ESRD patients between the ages of 30 and 70 years who are listed for
             renal transplantation

          -  Able to sign pre-transplant consent on their own will

          -  Have english as their native language

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Current use of antipsychotics or anti-epileptics

          -  Inability to read or write which will limit their ability to perform the cognitive
             tests

          -  Claustrophobia or inability to get MRI for other reasons

          -  Unable to sign consent

study_pop.textblock:
The study population will include patients from the renal transplant waiting list at
        University of Kansas Medical Center. They will be tested before renal transplant and 3
        months after renal transplantation.

clinical_study.official_title: Cognitive Impairment and Imaging Correlates in End Stage Renal Disease

other_outcome.measure: Change in brain MRI findings and serum inflammatory markers post transplantation and its correlation with cognition
other_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 3 Months after Renal Transplant

primary_outcome.description: Cognitive testing will be performed for assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 3 Months after Renal Transplant

secondary_outcome.description: Brain MRI will be performed before and after transplant
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 3 Months after Renal Transplant
Change from Baseline to 3 months post transplant
